p.s: In the following I am going to describe the situation Starr finds herself in.
This scene describes what happens to her while the protest.
At first she is thinking back to the night Khalil got shot.
Her emotions went crazy and she remembers all the words of Officer Cruise, the police officer who killed Starr's friend Khalil brutally.
Remembering everything while seeing so many people protest for justice encourages Starr to join and ifht for the rights of Khalil and every other African American who were treated unequally.
After she talked to Ms. Ofrah, Starr takes the weapon and talks to the crowd against the demand of the police, who were there too.
She is telling the trurth and in her opinion there is no reason why she should stop.
With all her feelings she is using her voice to attract the crowd's and the policespolice's attention.
